text: In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI systems, there's a growing need to examine potential biases that could impact vulnerable communities. To tackle this challenge, we conducted a controlled experiment utilizing Virtual Reality (VR) technology to explore empathy levels in response to a biased AI system. Participants were immersed in different personas reflecting varied financial credit scores based on age and gender. Our study revealed that participants in VR experienced heightened empathy towards the characters they embodied and perceived the AI as less fair compared to a standard scenario where they imagined being these characters. Additionally, we delved into the nuances of embodied personas and discussed qualitative findings to gain deeper insights into participants' cognitive processes.
